newsitem.title: FRANCE: Britain's Blair arrives in France on vacation.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Blair arrives in France on vacation.

text.p: British Prime Minister Tony Blair and his family arrived in southwestern France from Italy on Saturday for the second leg of a summer holiday.

The Blairs were expected to spend the night with friends in the small village of Miradoux before going to Saint Martin d'Oydes to stay for several days at the home of David Keene, a London lawyer, local officials said.

Saint Martin d'Oydes is 30 km (20 miles) from Cintegabelle, the main city in the parliamentary district represented by French Prime Minster Lionel Jospin. The two leaders are expected to meet later in the week, aides said.
Blair, who is vacationing with his wife Cherie and their children Nicolas, Kathryn and Euan, met Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi in Bologna at the start of his visit to Italy on August 2.
